main event: A civilian observed a bright, pulsating light in the sky over Dayton, Ohio on August 8, 1961.
interesting points: The object hovered and then moved rapidly to the northwest.
The witness was greatly impressed by the sighting and reported it to the Air Force.
The Air Force investigators could not definitively identify the object and listed several possible explanations, including balloon, aircraft, astronomical, or unconventional spacecraft.
The sighting lasted for approximately 30 minutes.
The object appeared brighter than the brightest stars.
sighted object: a bright, pulsating light in the sky
